intro: Amasonia hirta var. paraensis, commonly known as the Paraensis hairystem, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or violet in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments in tropical forests.
